Feb 2

Developments

Office Escape has been progressing! Starting to feel more and more accomplished and closer to the experience I want people to have with each small task completed. Here’s a few things that have been added recently -

Feedback

While I understood how the game worked, I needed to start thinking about how to communicate this to the player within the game world. No one likes a confusing game. I’ve begun by adding ‘Hit’ and ‘Miss’ pop-ups when shooting at an enemy. With this, I can apply the same code to other in game occurrences such as when the player collects a pick-up or an enemy is shooting at the player.

GUI

I’ve upgraded the GUI from the pre-Unity 4.6 style. Because I didn’t spend too much time previously on the GUI this was quick and seamless. Trying to craft an alpha of the game, I wanted the GUI to look cleaner and I needed to begin this before the game got too complex. It’s also a lot easier to add, test and remove the different components and placements for the UI elements.

Enemies

Always always always working on enemy actions and AI. Making sure this works in priority number one as it will be the most important interaction the player has with the game. I added characteristics to enemies so they will now search for the player once they wake-up before continuing to move. This creates the incentive for the player to continue moving through the game and the desired effect of the main game design.

What I’ve been playin when I ain’t codin’

I’ve been on a bit of an FPS kick lately swapping regularly between DOOM and Overwatch.

DOOM. DOOM is fucking fast, violent and gory. But don’t let that fool you from the clever level design and challenges. The mini challenges and grading system for each level automatically make me want go back and replay each area scanning for what I’ve missed.

Overwatch is like TF2 used to be before all the bullshit. Again, the gameplay is fast and frantic. I love that Blizzard have refined a known genre down to the simplest options, making interesting choices with character classes for each one to feel fresh but still giving plenty to master.

I really enjoy the events and new modes that the game adds on a regular basis, though I do wish I could just buy the costumes instead of the blind boxes.

I have been also testing some exports to HTML 5 in preparation for alpha testing t some feedback on the game so far. Hopefully, I’ll be able to post a link up soon once I feel confident that people will be able to get a feel for what I’m aiming for.
